decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Cloudpost lands and Ancient Tomb, allowing for the early casting of powerful threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms. The deck aims to control the board with counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation while setting up a game-winning combo with Thundertrap Trainer and The One Ring. Planar Nexus provides additional value and disruption, while cards like Chalice of the Void and Sink into Stupor help to disrupt opponent's game plan.

The key idea of this deck is to quickly set up the combo of Show and Tell to put powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play for free using Omniscience. The deck includes various ways to find and protect the combo pieces, such as Ponder, Brainstorm, Force of Will, Daze, and Cunning Wish. The deck also includes other utility cards like Veil of Summer and Stock Up to help disrupt the opponent's strategy while advancing your own game plan.

The deck aims to quickly combo off by milling the entire library and either winning with Thassa's Oracle or activating Boggart Trawler's ability. It utilizes free mana accelerators like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide, along with rituals like Dark Ritual to cast a string of spells in a single turn. The deck also includes protection in the form of Pact of Negation and Chancellor of the Annex. Once Upon a Time helps in finding combo pieces quickly, while Agadeem's Awakening can bring back key creatures from the graveyard.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly assemble the pieces needed to combo off and deal a massive amount of damage to the opponent in a single turn. By utilizing cards like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual to generate mana, as well as cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to set up a powerful combination of spells like Necrodominance and Soul Spike to finish off the opponent swiftly. Additionally, cards like March of Wretched Sorrow and Fell the Profane provide additional disruption and control elements to ensure the combo goes off smoothly.

The main concept behind this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by playing powerful disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Blood Moon early on. By using mana accelerants like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide, you can quickly deploy threats like Magus of the Moon and Obsidian Charmaw to pressure your opponent while also ramping into bigger threats like Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance and The One Ring. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a mix of disruption and aggressive creatures to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful board presence quickly through the use of mana acceleration and the Mystic Forge combo. By utilizing cards like Ancient Tomb and Grim Monolith to generate mana, the deck aims to play high impact threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Glaring Fleshraker early on. The Mystic Forge allows the player to cast artifacts from the top of their library, gaining card advantage and enabling explosive turns. The deck also includes pieces like Manifold Key and Urza's Tower to further support the combo strategy.

The focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently combo off by milling the entire library and winning the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck includes a variety of fast mana sources, protection spells, and creatures that facilitate the combo. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with discard spells while racing to assemble the necessary pieces for the win. The deck's strategy revolves around executing the combo as quickly as possible, often winning in just a few turns.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, and then bringing them back onto the battlefield for a huge advantage. The goal is to outpace and overwhelm opponents with early threats like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Murktide Regent, while disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Force of Will. By efficiently utilizing these graveyard interactions, the deck aims to create a winning board state that is difficult for opponents to overcome.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Cloudpost ramp strategy to quickly generate large amounts of mana, allowing you to cast powerful spells and lock down the opponent with cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator. The deck includes multiple ways to disrupt your opponent's plays, such as Force of Will and Force of Negation. By efficiently ramping up your resources and controlling the board, you can overwhelm your opponent and dominate the game. Additionally, you have access to powerful finishers like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Kozilek's Command to seal the victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Mystic Forge card to combo off with various artifacts and key cards like Planar Nexus, Karn, the Great Creator, and Grim Monolith. The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with cards like Ancient Tomb and Urza's Tower, while also controlling the board with cards like Tormod's Crypt and Pithing Needle. With a mix of artifact synergy and powerful combos, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and achieve victory through a combination of mana generation, card advantage, and powerful artifact abilities.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disrupt their mana base with cards like Chalice of the Void and Magus of the Moon. By utilizing cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox, the deck aims to quickly ramp up and put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of Archon of Emeria and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provides additional disruption and control elements, while Seasoned Dungeoneer offers card advantage. The deck's strategy is to establish board presence quickly and maintain control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays using efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Wasteland and Daze. The deck also utilizes card selection and card advantage with cards like Brainstorm, Mishra's Bauble, and Preordain. Additionally, the deck includes a strong removal package with Lightning Bolt and Brazen Borrower. The mana base is streamlined for consistency and includes fetchlands to ensure the right colors of mana are available.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, while also utilizing disruption from cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker. The deck also seeks to control the opponent's resources with land destruction effects like Wasteland. This deck focuses on applying pressure early and maintaining board dominance throughout the game.

The main concept of this Mystic Forge combo deck is to generate a large amount of mana using cards like Grim Monolith and Urza's Tower, and then utilize cards like Mystic Forge and Karn, the Great Creator to assemble powerful combos quickly. The deck also focuses on controlling the board with cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Planar Nexus, while using artifact synergy with cards like Manifold Key and Voltaic Key. The inclusion of cards like The One Ring and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain adds another layer of control and power to the deck, making it a versatile and formidable combo deck in the Legacy format.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and land destruction. It utilizes efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Delver of Secrets alongside powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will to apply pressure and control the board. The deck also has utility cards like Surgical Extraction for graveyard hate and Brazen Borrower for tempo plays. By combining aggression with disruption, this UR Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

The key focus of this deck is to maintain control of the board by disrupting the opponent's strategy while steadily applying pressure with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. The deck utilizes a mix of disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Daze, along with removal like Fatal Push and Brazen Borrower, to control the game tempo. Nethergoyf and Orcish Bowmasters provide the aggro element, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student offers card advantage and flexibility. The mana base is designed to support both blue and black spells, with a focus on consistency and flexibility in casting spells.
